titleStmt.title: James I. Hundnall et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7550

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

The undersigned Citizens of Pendleton County and neighbors of Wm H Gardner State that the Sad Said Gardner was fined under an indictment in the Pendleton Circuit Court in the Sum of three hundred dollars $300 -- 00 and costs at its the Oct Term 1865. of Said court under the charge of Keeping a gambling house in Said County Some five years ago. The gambling took place in the bar room over which a man by the name of Brown had the exclusive control, and over which Said Gardner assumed no control, Said Gardner is a poor man, and we recommend him under the Circumstances to your Clemency, Decr 12th 1865,

Jas. I. Hudnall
Wm Childes
M Mullins
Geo W Jameson
Josiah McKinly
H. Kennett
G. A. Lightfoot
Willis Lovelace
W. F. Clark
E,,
Philip Rochford
E. M. plumle
F. C. F
T. F. Roberts
P Rochford
R, Shey
D, Bailey
S. W. Marshall
Charles Fletcher
H. N. Newman

Pendleton Cir Ct.
vs
Wm Gardner
$200
Remitted
